div.div: Enter to Learn, Go Forth to ServeThe District's motto, "Enter to Learn, Go Forth to Serve", forms the core of the District's vision statement and serves as a guiding principle for students and staff.

Agendas & Meeting Minutes For board meeting agendas and minutes, please visit our BoardDocs site.
Visit BoardDocs >>

A Qualified TeamThe District's professional staff consists of more than 630 full time teachers, 80% of whom have advanced degrees. The faculty is complemented by a support staff of more than 500 skilled individuals.

Academics Spotlight LMSD maintains one of the lowest class size averages in Pennsylvania. The student-to-professional staff ratio at the secondary level is 11:1 and average class size in the District is approximately 21 students.
Ten Schools of ExcellenceLMSD's six elementary schools, two middle schools and two high schools have all been recognized for excellence at the regional and national levels.

Our Community Lower Merion is a community characterized by a deep sense of civic pride and involvement -- and a passion for public education. In a recent survey, residents cited the community's convenient location and high-quality public schools as the two "best things about living in Lower Merion."

article.div: March 30th COVID-19 Update from Superintendent Copeland

div.p: Today, Gov. Wolf extended the stay-at-home order covering Montgomery County through April 30, 2020. Schools are now closed indefinitely. Lower Merion schools and all other District facilities, therefore, will remain closed to all but personnel performing essential functions. Remote learning will continue, except during Spring Break, which will occur as scheduled from April 6-10, 2020.

The District will continue to distribute meals to children on Mondays and Wednesdays from 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. in the Suburban Square parking lot at Montgomery and Anderson Avenues (across from the former Ruby's site). To help us get an accurate count for meals, please click here to register. Registration is suggested, but not mandatory.
As a reminder, everyone should continue to follow all CDC guidelines regarding handwashing and maintaining physical distance. Students should not be taking part in gatherings of any kind.
Finally, we realize that this is a difficult time for just about everyone. Our school counselors and nurses are available to help.
We hope to see everyone as soon as it is safe.
